summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from the Warden of MCC New York to the Medical Director, dated November 5, 2019, responding to a multi-level mortality review. It includes attached procedures for monitoring, testing, and inspecting Automated External Defibrillators (AEDs) at the facility, along with a monthly inspection checklist for November 2019. The document appears to be part of a post-mortem review of procedures following an inmate death.

persons.name: Jeffery D. Allen
persons.context: Recipient of the memorandum from the Warden regarding AED procedures and mortality review recommendations.

persons.name: Warder
persons.context: Author of the memorandum addressing AED procedure recommendations following a mortality review.

connections.description: The Warden is formally responding to the Medical Director regarding recommendations from a mortality review.

events.title: Multi-Level Mortality Review Completion
events.description: A multi-level mortality review was completed, resulting in recommendations concerning Automated External Defibrillators at MCC New York.

events.title: Monthly AED Inspection
events.description: Monthly inspection and testing of all AEDs at MCC New York was conducted, as documented on the November 2019 checklist.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a direct response to a 'multi-level mortality review' dated October 29, 2019, indicating an internal review following an inmate death.
It establishes new, detailed procedures for monthly and bi-annual inspection and testing of all Automated External Defibrillators (AEDs) at MCC New York.
The attached checklist for November 2019 shows AEDs were located in key areas including the Sallyport, SHU (Special Housing Unit), PCU unit, Urgent Care Room, and the Warden's Complex.
The memorandum's existence suggests institutional scrutiny of medical emergency preparedness at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein died.
